title: Expressing Opinions
description: Practice English phrases used for expressing opinions. Emphasize clear pronunciation and confident intonation.
instructions: Below is a list of phrases that are useful for expressing your opinions.
Aim for clear and assertive pronunciation.
Maintain a conversational and steady pace.
After recording, listen to your playback and compare it to the text.
Pay attention to intonation, clarity, and fluency.
Repeat the recording process as needed to improve your pronunciation.

items.question: I think it's a good idea.
items.answer: I think it's a good idea.

items.question: In my opinion, it's too expensive.
items.answer: In my opinion, it's too expensive.

items.question: I think we should travel more.
items.answer: I think we should travel more.

scoring.5-7 correct pronunciations: Good! You're mostly accurate in expressing your opinions, but some phrases could be improved for clarity.
scoring.2-4 correct pronunciations: Fair. You can communicate your opinions, but your pronunciation needs more work for clearer expression.
scoring.0-1 correct pronunciations: Needs improvement. Focus on practicing these phrases to better express your opinions in English.
